title.$: Shanghai.  A Buddhist temple in the old city.

physicalLocation.$: The Miriam and Ira D. Wallach Division of Art, Prints and Photographs: Picture Collection

note.$: "A Buddhist temple in the old city.  To Europeans, Shanghai means the superb foreign settlement, British, French, American, but there was a Shanghai before this, a busy trading city with narrow noisome streets; its old temples begrimed with the smoke of countless incense-sticks used by many generations of worshppers."--printed on verso.

"Copyright London" "The 'Wide-Wide-World' series" "Scenes in Shanghai Series 1."  "Raphael Tuck & Sons' 'Oilette' Postcard No. 8952" "Art publishers to their Majesties the King & Queen."--printed on verso.
